title.rendered: Underprivileged women and girl children from six slum clusters to get proper health care

content.rendered: A two-year long project which will bring access of healthcare to the population, with focus on women, girl children and adolescents has been implemented in the areas of New Ashok Nagar, Shashi Garden, and Bismil Camp in East Delhi as well as Chattarpur Nut Colony, Chattarpur Pahari and Ambedkar Colony in South Delhi. Itâ€™s a two year long project. Under the same, four health camps per month will be organized, benefiting at least 7000 beneficiaries including men and boys, women, adolescent girls, and children in the identified communities. Besides curative services, community engagement for awareness sessions and educational activities will be conducted to ensure awareness, adolescent health care, child survival, safe motherhood, community empowerment and services to migrant population. Smile Foundation and Baxter International Foundation have come together for this initiative.
